CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 7, 1962, pg. 9, reads: "Trent - Martin Nuptials Held - Minister and Bride - The Rev. and Mrs. Robert J. Martin were married recently at Friendship Baptist Church. The bride is the former Elizabeth Trent.  The groom is an assistant pastor of Corinthian Baptist Church. - Harris Photo."  Accompanying article reads: "During a recent ceremony at Friendship Baptist Church, Elizabeth Trent became the bride of Robert J. Martin.  The Rev. V. M. Herron officiated at the Rainbow Wedding.  Given in marriage by her brother, Earl W. Trent, the bride wore a beautiful white silk organza floor-length gown with a matching shoulder-length veil.  Bridal attendants included Laura Cato, matron of honor; Patricia Trent, niece of the bride; Lucy Trent, sister of the bride; Iona Poindexter and Bessie West were bridesmaids.  Little Beatrice Jackson, niece of the bride was flower girl.  Troy L. Stewart was best man.  Ushers were: William Gee, Earl Brundridge, Clyde Reid and Lou Washington.  Mrs. Georgie Norris directed the wedding.  The groom who was a sergeant in World War II graduated from the Ministers Seminary College and is a member of Corinthian Baptist Church, serving as an assistant pastor there.  A reception for the newlyweds was held at the home of the bride."
TitMainTitle: Groom Rev. Robert J. Martin wearing tuxedo, and bride Elizabeth Trent Martin wearing full silk organza gown, posed in Friendship Baptist Church
